meanings.definition: A class of chemical compounds found in plants that have soap-like properties.
meanings.sent1: The saponin in the plant helps create a soapy lather when mixed with water.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use saponin from certain plants to make natural cleaning products.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the saponin in the acorns would make them taste like soap!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up like saponin in a washing machine, infectious and frothy.
meanings.sent5: The saponin in the roots of the tree acted like a natural detergent, cleansing the soil around it.

meanings.definition: Any of various plant glycosides that form soapy lathers when mixed and agitated with water.
meanings.sent1: When you mix water with the plant extract, the saponin creates a foamy lather.
meanings.sent2: The herbal shampoo contains saponin to produce a gentle cleansing effect.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they discovered the saponin in the berries made their hands slippery like soap.
meanings.sent4: His words were smooth and slick, coated in saponin, making them easy to swallow.
meanings.sent5: As the river rushed over the rocks, it appeared as if saponin bubbles were forming in the rapids.
